intro: Casselia hassleri, commonly known as the rock cassia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its fruit is a small, dry capsule. Casselia hassleri is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
